casebody.data:
Faulkner v. Todd and Another. SCIRE FACIAS on a mortgage. Plea, a former judgment for the debt secured by the mortgage — an execution on that judgment — a replevin — and an execution on the replevin bond levied on real estate, the property remaining in the sheriff’s hands unsold for want of buyers.

Held, on general demurrer, that the plea was good; the defendant not being liable to other proceedings for the same debt, while the property seized remained unsold in the hands of the sheriff. M'Intosh et al. v. Chew et al. ante, p. 289.
